meanings.definition: The process of making something denser or more concentrated.
meanings.sent1: During the experiment, the condensations of the liquid were carefully observed.
meanings.sent2: The condensations of the solution resulted in a more potent mixture.
meanings.sent3: The condensations of the ingredients in the recipe made the dish taste richer.
meanings.sent4: Her focus was like the condensations of thoughts, gathering into a single idea.
meanings.sent5: The condensations of knowledge in the textbook made it easier to understand complex concepts.

meanings.definition: A liquid that is condensed from a gas.
meanings.sent1: The scientist collected the condensations of the vapor in a test tube.
meanings.sent2: The condensations formed on the window pane during the cold night.
meanings.sent3: The condensations on the mirror made funny shapes after a hot shower.
meanings.sent4: The condensations of mist in the forest created a mystical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The condensations of raindrops on the leaves sparkled in the sunlight.
